children.subject:
<md>- tangible experience teaching 61a students
- reinforces understanding of course content
- demonstrates genuine interest and commitment to teaching
- build relationships with current course staff members
  - ASE application recommends including references who can speak to your teaching abilities
  - learn how current TAs got to where they are</md>

ASE: academic student employee

All paid members of EECS course staffs are ASEs (i.e. tutors, readers, TAs). To become a TA, you have to fill out the ASE app:

https://deptapps.coe.berkeley.edu/ase/eecs/apply
What are the direct benefits of being an AI? How does it help in ultimately becoming a TA?
<md>Hi, please reach out via email: larynqi@berkeley.edu</md>

I submitted my application for the AI position for 61A some time ago but I updated my responses right now to better reflect my thoughts. I'm wondering if the applications already been looked over. If they have been, would it be possible to have my application reconsidered? 

Thanks!

<md>> **The deadline to apply is January 17, 2022 at 11:59pm.** We will send out application results a few days later.

now that this deadline has passed, we'll begin going through applications and making decisions. you can expect results in a few days!</md>
Hello, I still didn't receive an answer... Are we going to receive emails if we aren't accepted?

Hello,

I have submitted my application for the AI position for 61A when the application opened up. I have not heard from 61A staff yet. How long do I need to anticipate before I hear back from them?

Thank you.

Hello,

When will AI application be open for Summer CS61A?

history.content:
HI EVERYONE!

I hope you've been enjoying your break 🥳🥳🥳 I’m excited to announce that we are continuing the CS 61A Academic Intern (AI) program for Spring 2022, and the application is open!

We’d love to have your help to continue scaling this class to support as many students as we can.

CS 61A AIs are former 61A students who help out in running parts of the course. Specifically, AIs will be helping out in labs next semester. Labs are a 1.5 hour section each week where students work on the weekly lab programming assignment with the help of a TA + AIs. AIs will go around and answer questions that students have about the problems in the lab and sometimes help the TA out with mini-lecturing about new material.

You will be working with the same TA and cohort of AIs throughout the semester, so it’s a great way to meet people, gain teaching experience, and receive mentorship about teaching, Berkeley, and the CS community.

We welcome anyone who received a B or higher in 61A to apply to be an academic intern.

Responsibilities Include:

  • 1.5 hours of helping out at lab each week (must attend all but 2 labs during the semester)

  • 1 hour of prep time each week (this includes a weekly prep assignment)

  • Attend a 61A AI Orientation (on January 29th)

  • Complete a mid-semester survey

  • Complete TA check-ins

All AIs are required to receive 1 P/NP unit for Academic Interning (CS 197).

If you are interested, please fill out this application (it is non-binding):

https://go.cs61a.org/ai-app

The deadline to apply is January 17, 2022 at 11:59pm. We will send out application results a few days later.

If you have any questions, please leave them below or email me at larynqi@berkeley.edu. Being an AI for 61A was one of the reasons I fell in love with the course, and I hope you apply so you can have a great experience too!
